Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Lets break down the original process: 1. Start Event --> Task A: Receive Customer Request 2. Gateway XOR: Check Request Type - Standard Path: Task B1: Perform Standard Validation Gateway AND: Run Parallel Checks Task C1: Credit Check Task C2: Inventory Check Join Task D: Calculate Delivery Date - Custom Path: Task B2: Perform Custom Feasibility Analysis Gateway XOR: Is Customization Feasible? If Yes: Task E1: Prepare Custom Quotation If No: Task E2: Send Rejection Notice --> End Event 3. After both paths Gateway XOR: Is Approval Needed? If Yes: Task F: Obtain Manager Approval Gateway XOR: Is Approval Granted? If Yes: Task G: Generate Final Invoice If No: Task H: Re-evaluate Conditions --> Loop back  If No: Task G: Generate Final Invoice 4. Task I: Send Confirmation to Customer --> End Event

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Key Issues and Opportunities for Optimization: 1. Turnaround Time: The standard path has parallel tasks which is good, but the custom path may take longer due to manual feasibility analysis and quotation preparation. The approval step can cause delays, especially if it requires multiple iterations. 2. Flexibility for Non-Standard Requests: The custom path might be rigid. 3. Automation Opportunities: Many tasks like credit check, inventory check can be automated. 4. Predictive Analytics: Predict at the beginning whether a request is likely to be standard or custom. 5. Dynamic Resource Reallocation: Assign tasks to the best available resource.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Proposed Redesign: We will restructure the process to incorporate: - Predictive Routing: Use predictive analytics at the start to classify the request. - Automation: Automate as many tasks as possible. - Dynamic Resource Assignment: Use a resource management system. - Parallelization and Concurrency: Run tasks in parallel. - Streamlining the Approval Loop: Refine the quotation iteratively without repeating the entire process.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Redesigned Process: Step-by-Step Redesign: 1. Start Event --> Task A: Receive Customer Request - Enhancement: Use an automated system. 2. High Confidence Custom and Feasible: Route to custom skip feasibility. High Confidence Custom but Not Feasible: Send rejection. Low Confidence: Detailed analysis. 3. Standard Path: Task B1 automated, Parallel Checks automated, Task D automated. 4. Custom Path: If predicted feasible skip B2, else B2 partially automated, then E1 with base automated quotation. 5.
